issue.title: Release schedule for 0.13.0
issue.body:
Posting this here too, may be easier to find than the mailing list. Also the dates can be edited here if necessary.

```
Proposed release schedule for 0.13.0:

2016-06-01
-----------
- Open Transifex translations for 0.13
- Soft translation string freeze (no large or unnecessary string changes until release)
- Finalize and close translations for 0.11

2016-06-16
-----------
- Feature freeze (bug fixes only until release)
- Translation string freeze (no more source language changes until release)

2016-07-06
-----------
- Split off `0.13` branch from `master`
- Start RC cycle, tag and release `0.13.0rc1`
- Start merging for 0.14 on master branch

2016-08-01
-----------
- Release 0.13.0 final (aim)
```

Original ref: https://lists.linuxfoundation.org/pipermail/bitcoin-dev/2016-March/012562.html
Meeting log 2016-04-15: http://www.erisian.com.au/meetbot/bitcoin-core-dev/2016/bitcoin-core-dev.2016-04-14-19.00.log.html

events.body: Thanks for posting this here @laanwj,  especially helpful for those of us that don't track the mailing list :+1:

> for the first 2 I assume?

Yea updated.
According to the meeting discussion on 2016-04-14 I've moved all the dates forward by one month.
Moved the feature freeze from 2016-06-15 to 2016-06-16, can't be there on the 15th. One day extra, hooray.
@laanwj: 0.13 wasn't split yet. Is 2016-08-01 still the target for the release?

> Is 2016-08-01 still the target for the release?

If no issues pop up during the rc phase, it seems likely that the release will happen within a week or two after rc1.

Though, some bug fixes and other pulls need to be reviewed and merged (preferably before rc1). Please refer to https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/milestone/20 and help review the outstanding pull request.

@marcofalke is correct.
rc1 is still blocked on some issues at this moment, and I think it makes sense to split off the 0.13 branch just before releasing 0.13.0rc1. Could do it before that, but I don't think there's that much pressure to start merging for 0.14 yet (and it would involve a lot of extra rebasing work).
I believe this can be closed!
